column4: Can anyone help me pairing my Ubuntu laptop and my Nokia 6300 via bluetooth?
ok.. I'll give it a try.. what have you tried so far?
thanx
do you see the little bluetooth icon in the task tray?
ok.. have you tried right clicking on that bluetooth icon and chosing "Setup new device"?
ok.. you don't get some kind of "Enter pin number" dialog?
no
ok.. I've got my cell phone here.. I'll just delete the pairing I've got and try to set it up again..
hmm.. I just get "Pairing with Nokia 5310 failed"
I got the same thing
believe it or not, now it's working
I didn't change anything and suddenly my phone is recognized and I can pair it
did you do anything special? =)
I wish =)
this is most unfair.. now it doesn't work for me.. is there a limit on how many bluetooth pairing there can be in the world at one time?? I think you took my slot =)
I am now connected to slart-dekstop, is that a problem?
hehe..
sorry mate, wish I could help you. Thanx for trying, though...
no worries.. I just hope mine starts working out of the blue too =)
that's odd.. it worked if I initiated the pairing from the cell phone.. but not if from ubuntu
Initially, it wouldn't work, whether I started from my phone or from my computer. Eventually, it worked when I started from my computer. It seems to lose the connection, though...
hmm.. I can't transfer files from/to my cell phone either.. I could do that on 8.04
but they've changed the bluetooth tools.. might be a new bug
seems like it's a common problem with intrepid, http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=964139
